text: Sampled from the tap at Mason City Brewing. Pours a clear reddish Amber with a tan head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a good amount of bread with straw and grain supporting. Flavor is bread and grain forward with a bit of straw in the finish.
Tap at brewery. Pours amber with red hues and off white head. Aroma is caramel, nuts, cereal. Taste is medium bodied, a bit thin, light bitter finish. Overall, boring.
Draft. Clear amber maroon color, off white head. Aroma of caramel on toast. Taste is malty burnt caramel, rich body. Tasty.
Attractive deep brown color. Heavy malt body, with biscuity and nutty notes. Not a lot of hop character.
On tap at the brewpub. Dry but not too dry.. 44. Ibu red very balanced amber.

Pour on tap at the brewery, clear reddish pour with off white head, aroma brought notes of caramel, toast, dough into a bit of yeast, slight earth into a bit of spice, grass in there as well. Taste was a mix of orange, fruit, some pine into a bit of caramel, toffee, toast into a bit of spice, finishing slightly bitter, slightly sweet.
Growler from the TG tap room poured a dark reddish amber with a thin head. Aromas of malt, slight fruitiness, caramel, and bread. Medium bodied with a hint of sweet. Very drinkable.
Caramel brûlé, agrumes, chocolat et une amertume progressive. La signature végétale est particulièrement alléchante et combiné à la maltitude, cest un minerai de buvabilité.
Draft at TG. Clear copper pour; cherry cola and caramel. Sweet, light body, short lightly bitter finish. Easy drinking beer.

On tap at Dexters Pub in Madison, on GTMW eve. Mostly clear dark red color. Good thin off-white / khaki head. Leaves good bits of lace. Medium-plus body. Smooth, kind of crisp, lighter carbonation. Light slick texture. Some caramel malt. Dark fruit, earthy hoppy character. Light to moderate bitter taste, moderate sweet. Some nutty, chocolate notes in the finish. Pretty solid Irish red ale.

Amber brown with khaki head with yellow tinge. Cereal aroma with caramel malt. Taste is the same with a pine bitterness. Medium mouthfeel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft. An extremely pedestrian red ale, mold hops, lgiht sweetness ot the malt, not much going on here.
Very malty. Actually more dark sweet malt than Irish red. Kinda reminded me more if Robert the Bruce. Pretty solid stuff

Pours a dark amber color with a small head that leaves some lacing on the glass. 

Aroma has some toasted caramel & light chocolate maltiness, fairly clean, fairly faint, fine enough. 

The flavor has a pretty rich and well rounded maltiness, most defiantly some chocolate & dark caramel malt are there. Its got a light touch of leafy happiness... some earthy tones. The beer is a touch sweet, but not cloying at all.

At the source, in a sampler shared with the just-21 year old. Pours ruby colored with no head. Aroma has bread and nuts and light stone fruits. Tastes follows, more fruity than the aroma. Medium bodied but light in taste and presentation. Finishes sweetly. Inoffensive, but likely not in the top 10 of their 15 taps. Shrug?
Draft pour at the source. Pours a clear dark amber with a beige head of foam. The aroma is toasty and bready. Toasty taste and a little sweet. Light body and low carbonation.
On tap at the brewpub it is a dark amber Color with a slight head. It has the aroma ofvcitrus and the taste is bitter and has no true fidtinctvflavor that shined through
On draft at the the brewpub. Pours a dark amber with an ecru head. Nutty aroma. Flavors of toasted nuts. Medium bodied and moderate carbonation.
Pour from a growler. Dark amber with a nice tan head. Malty and slightly hoppy nose. Easy drinking, mild and tasty.

Tap at Dexters. Burgundy amber. Thin, oily head laces the glass. Fruity amber malt, but very well balanced by the caramel malt tones. Medium to full bodied. Pretty respectable offering, quite clean and balanced. Fruity toffee finish. Nice.
On tap at Shorts in Iowa City. Pours an amber brown color with white head. Caramel, toffee, nutty, malty flavors. Irish red isnt one of my favorite styles, but this one isnt too bad.

Tap @ Shorts Iowa City. Pours a clear deep reddish orange appearance with a light brown head. Toffee, a touch burnt, caramel, earthy aroma. Burnt, a bit smoky, fairly sweet toffee, caramel, lightly herbal flavor. A bit sweet but alright.
On tap at the brewpub.  Comes a darker amber with a small biege head.  Aroma of caramel, malt, and fruit.  Taste is caramel malt, fruit, roast, and grass.  Nice Irish Ale.
Tap at Toppling Goliath. Pours a dark red with some white head. Good caramel malts and good hops. Pretty decent beer, not really my style.

Draft on tap at the tap room (Decorah, IA). Pours a richer deep copper pour, a touch brownish, good haziness with frothy tannish head atop. Dies to a filmy layer, laces ok. Aromas are a touch sweet, biscuity. Some dry earthy hops, grass and florals, mellow yeast. Initial is a light biscuity malt, touch of toffee. Bready, dry, some mellow spice, faint dark fruit. Middle is a bit more dry, inviting with some toastiness, some gentle dry earthy hops, touch of carmelization. Backend shows the hops at its most prominent poit, dry, earthy, faint spice. Finish is a touch toasty, dry, biscuity. Earthy hops. A touch sweet overall, but pretty solid.
dark amber pour with a small off white head. Toffee and caramel, some chocolate, and just a touch of grassy hops. Clean finish, good carbonation. Not bad for the style

On tap at Toppling Goliath, nice golden/reddish color. Scent is some caramel and a bit if hops. Taste is very similar, hops in front and a bit of roasted malt finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Dexters, pours a clear dark amber red with a nice off white head and a little bit of lacing, the aroma is of malt and a little bit of caramel, the flavor is sweet on the front end with a caramel finish, nice mouthfeel, not bad.

Tap. Pours clear reddish brown with a small tan head and decent lacing. Aroma is caramel dominated. Flavor is more nuanced with notes of caramel, toffee, hay. Mildly sweet with minimal bitterness. Medium body.
Tap at the brewpub. Chestnut pour with a clingy head. Sweet caramel malt dominates this one. Full flavored with a moderate palate.

Man, LOVE beers like this! Served with a huge, foamy, frothy, sudsy, tan head that slowly subsides to a light cover which lasts alllll the way down and lots of clingy lace. Color is a slightly hazy, dusky amber red. Aroma is very malty, a hint of roast, fruit, toffee, and biscuit. Flavors like nose and has a killer combination of sweet, carbonic tang, fruit and bitter from hop, and hint of roasty dry at the end that makes this stuff dangerously tasty. Body and carbonation are perfect. Finish is of average length, and like I say, eminently drinkable.

Draft at Reds. Poured a slightly hazy ruddy dark orange color. The head was thin and tan. Smelled of brown sugar and dates. Medium bodied and slightly sweet. Brown sugar and earthy hop dominated with hints of toffee and black cherry. A fresh cereal grain note emerged at the end.

Tap at TG.  Aroma: toasty, lots of caramel malt, light sweetness.  Pours a muddy copper/red color, off-white head with decent retention and lacing.  Big caramel flavor, a hint of roast, light bitterness, some bread crust, fairly dry finish.  Medium body and carbonation.
